subject: Re: [junit] Testing for Objects returned in random order
msgSnippet: ... Sam, When faced with a question like this, I always ask, What are you trying to test? Are you trying to test your randomness algorithm or trying to test
messageBody:
sam.gribbles wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> I'm new to Junit testing and have been able to do some basic testing
> etc.
> What I want to do now is test for objects that are returned in random
> order. E.G. I have a few Fortune Cookies that are stored in an array of
> Strings. I've written some code that returns them randomly.
> What is the best method for testing? i.e. should I be using Mocks?
> If anybody has any good examples or relevant web sites please let me
> know.

Sam,

When faced with a question like this, I always ask, "What are you trying
to test?"

Are you trying to test your randomness algorithm or trying to test that
you can return a fortune given an index and that index happens to be random.

My best advice is to split the problem in half. Don't try to test
returning a random fortune. Test that, given a sequence of fortunes, you
can return the next one when asked. In your test system, you can set up
a known sequence of fortunes, and in your real system, you can set up a
random sequence. Hide the sequence generation behind an interface and
you can mock it for tests, and use real randomness in production.

I hope this makes sense :) If not, ask away again.
